title.narrative: Itireleng Community Council & Meho Zetu Support Gr

description.narrative: Reduce the transmission and impact of HIV/AIDS through support for prevention, care and treatment programs.

This award strives to reduce the transmission and impact of HIVAIDS through support for prevention, care and treatment programs. More specifically, this includes Itireleng Community Council & Meho Zetu Support Gr[Covers grants (including revenue-sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.]. participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Following the 2014 national and Presidential elections, Namibia came under new leadership that is striving to put the country on a path of prosperity for all Namibians. However, Namibia continues to face formidable development challenges that could prevent it from reaching its full potential. Notwithstanding Namibia's classification as an upper middle-income country, these challenges include one of the highest levels of income disparity worldwide, a poorly performing education system, a high unemployment rate, an estimated 14 percent HIV prevalence rate, and a high co-infection rate of tuberculosis (TB). U.S. assistance to Namibia will focus on a transition to sustainability in a post-emergency HIV response, on programs to strengthen local capacity to respond to the HIV/AIDS epidemic, and efforts to strengthen the U.S. government's ongoing military cooperation with the Government of the Republic of Namibia.
